troubleshooting.description: If you're having problems with your updates to your configuration, check the troubleshooting steps in <https://home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/troubleshooting/>

group.description: Groups allow the user to combine multiple entities into one, and create views in the default dashboard. See <https://home-assistant.io/components/group/> for information.

config.description: Enable the "Configuration" section of the UI by adding `config:` to your configuration.yaml file, docs: <https://home-assistant.io/components/config/>

input_number.description:
The `input_number` component allows the user to define values that can be controlled via the frontend and can be used within conditions of automation. The frontend can display a slider, or a numeric input box. Changes to the slider or numeric input box generate state events. These state events can be utilized as `automation` triggers as well.
```yaml
# Example configuration.yaml entry
input_number:
  slider1:
    name: Slider
    initial: 30
    min: -20
    max: 35
    step: 1
  box1:
    name: Numeric Input Box
    initial: 30
    min: -20
    max: 35
    step: 1
    mode: box
```
More information: <https://home-assistant.io/components/input_number/>

getting_started.description: When you're getting started, take the time to read [HA Docs Link](https://home-assistant.io/docs/) and have a look at the supported components [Supported Components](https://home-assistant.io/components/). You can find some worked examples at [HA Cookbook](https://home-assistant.io/cookbook/).

secrets.description: Rather than putting sensitive information (passwords, locations, etc) into your configuration, you can store them in secrets to make sharing easier. See <https://home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/secrets/> for more.

backup.description: Be sure to regularly, automatically, back up your Home Assistant install. There are various critical files and configuration options (like the Z-Wave network key), plus all your time. Hass.io has snapshots, and for unix type installs see <https://blog.ceard.tech/2017/10/backing-up-home-assistant.html>.  Oh, and most important of all **test your ability to restore regularly**.

wiki.description: You can find command info and other general information about HIVE on the wiki: [More information](https://github.com/Blade2021/HIVE/wiki)

DrZzzGithub.description: You can find the docs public github here: [Link](https://github.com/Snipercaine)

points.description: Points are used to give karma to other users.  Use ~getpoints to see how many points you have. [More information](https://github.com/Blade2021/HIVE/wiki/Karma)

suggestHelp.description: Wanna submit a suggestion?  Use ~suggest followed by your suggestion.  This will send your suggestion to our staff to review before being posted as a poll for the community to vote.

codeshare.description: Need to work with someone on writing code?  Try using https://codeshare.io

input_boolean.description: Input booleans allow an entity to be created to save a toggleable state.  You can find more about them here: [More information](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/input_boolean/)

faq.description: You can find rules, common bot commands, and answers to frequently asked questions in the #faq-and-rules channel.

LED_kulp.description:
[kulplights.com -Home of FPP based pixel controllers that can each drive 800 Pixels at 40FPS 1500 Pixels at 20fps per port ws281x ONLY ](https://kulplights.com/)
[FPP releases can be found here newest is at top ](https://github.com/FalconChristmas/fpp/releases)
[kulp k16- A 16 port controller that runs FPP Input voltage 5, or 12V selectable. *ADD-ONS NEEDED SCREEN,SDCARD,BEAGLEBONE,fm-transmitter*](https://kulplights.com/product/k16a-b/)
[kulp 32 port controller Input voltage 5, or 12V selectable. *ADD-ONS NEEDED SCREEN,SDCARD,BEAGLEBONE,fm-transmitter*](https://kulplights.com/product/k32a-b/)
[kulp k8-8 port controller Input voltage 5, or 12V selectable. *ADD-ONS NEEDED SCREEN,SDCARD,BEAGLEBONE*](https://kulplights.com/product/k8-b/)
[IF RUNNING WIFI YOU WILL NEED THIS ADAPTER](https://kulplights.com/product/1200mbs-antenna-wifi/)
[you might also need this usb hub](https://kulplights.com/product/usb-gigabit-ethernet-adapter/)
[The 4-String Differential Smart Receiver Board can be connected to many different controller options allowing 4 strings to be placed up to 300+ feet from the controllers . Input voltage 5, or 12V . The Smart Receiver can be daisy-chained together up to three.](https://kulplights.com/product/smart-receiver/)
[kulps user manual *listed as f8-b but works for all boards*](https://kulplights.com/manuals/F8-B-Manual.pdf)
[FPP Installing and Configuring Your Controller Step by Step - Rick Harris - VIDEO](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZV4o11XiaU0)

LED_falcon.description:

[Falcon PiCap for a pi3 or pi4 Can control two strings 800+ WS2811 pixels with fused and buffered outputs. Dedicated RS-485 DMX Output (Renard, DMX, LOR selectable). Input voltage 5, or 12V selectable.](https://www.pixelcontroller.com/store/index.php?id_product=47&controller=product)
